alert.note: Alert for Clark (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 04 at 9:50AM EST until March 04 at 5:35PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers... Great Miami River at Miamitown. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers... Mad River at Springfield. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers... Great Miami River at Sidney. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Mad River at Springfield. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, In addition to flooding along Lower Valley Pike between Old Mill Road and State Route 369, Spangler Road is flooded, and the I-70 Westbound exit to Medway at route 675 is closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EST Saturday the stage was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling to 1.9 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to developments by listening to NOAA Weather Radio. For additional details on river forecasts, visit water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=iln
